xmlParser
Class XMLParser

java.lang.Object
  xmlParser.XMLParser

public class XMLParser
extends java.lang.Object

This class takes the XML file containing all input information and parses it using a Document Object Model (DOM) parser, which creates a hierarchical tree with the tags stored as nodes. It then searches that tree and creates query, configuration, and job objects that contain all the necessary data. Furthermore, this parser validates the XMl based on the schema SolPickerSchema.xsd, and checks for errors in the input fields.

Version:
$Id: XMLParser.html,v 1.23 2009/08/14 21:13:34 tizatt Exp $
Author:
Arjun Chandrasekhar, Tyler Izatt and Erin Price-Wright
See Also:
XML Schema Website, XML file

Constructor

Method Detail

parse

public void parse()
Parses the XML file into a set of objects: Query, Configuration and Job. This parser works by retrieving all relevant elements from the DOM Tree and storing them according to their respective tag names (using lists). This parsing method ultimately creates 3 lists containing Query, Configuration and Job objects. Each job object contains its corresponding Queries and Configurations.

validateWithSchema

private void validateWithSchema()
Validates the XML based on the schema XML/SolPickerSchema.xsd. If there are any faults in the XML where the input does not conform to the schema, an error message is returned prompting the user to check the input. The XML will not be parsed if there are any errors. Guidelines for proper XML construction are given in the documentation for SolPicker.

setElementLists

private void setElementLists(org.w3c.dom.Document doc)
Gathers all the element tags in the XML and puts them into separate lists. Each list is a global list that is stored

Parameters:
doc -
See Also:
Configuration, Query, Job

parseQueries

private void parseQueries()
Parses queries, retrieving the chromosome, start position, end position, oligo lengths, oligo distance, organism, 3' padding, 5' padding, and domain. It also checks to make sure the query name is unique.

See Also:
Query

checkDomain

private java.lang.String checkDomain(org.w3c.dom.Node nDomain)
Retrieves the domain information from the xml file

Parameters:
nDomain -
Returns:
domain

parseConfiguration

private void parseConfiguration(org.w3c.dom.Node n)
Parses the configurations to create configuration objects, which hold filter objects. Prints an error message if a filter does not exist or if the configuration id is duplicate.

Parameters:
n -
See Also:
Configuration

parseFilter

private Filter parseFilter(org.w3c.dom.Node n)
                    throws FilterException
Parses filters to create filter objects within the configuration ojects. Valid filters are: lowercase, ncount, enzyme, gcpercent, and filscore. These filters have specific parameters, which this method retrieves. The filter objects store their parameters and constraints.

Parameters:
n - the Node containing the Filter
Returns:
the Filter contained in the Node
Throws:
FilterException
See Also:
Filter

parseFilterParameter

private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parseFilterParameter(org.w3c.dom.NodeList nParams)
This is a general method for retrieving filter parameters, no matter how many there are or what constraints they impose. It grabs the parameter attributes, which are constraints (min, max, et cetera) and the values of those constraints. Example: Constraint="max" Value="20" - This is stored as "max"->"20".

Parameters:
nParams -
Returns:
params - A map object containing constraints -> values

parseEnzymes

private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> parseEnzymes(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> hm)
Converts a HashMap of String objects into an ArrayList containing the values from that HashMap. This operation is performed because the parser uses HashMaps to store attributes, which is more convenient for error checking. But the EnzymeFilter class accepts ArrayLists, so these must be converted from maps to lists.

Parameters:
hm -
Returns:
list of enzymes

parseJob

private void parseJob(org.w3c.dom.Node n)
Parses to create job objects. Returns an error if the job is missing a valid query name or configuration id.

Parameters:
n -
See Also:
Job

isQueryUnique

private boolean isQueryUnique(Query q)
Checks whether this Query object has already been declared in the xml. By default the program will use the first instance of the id, and send a warning to the user.

Parameters:
q - - Query object
Returns:
true if there are no Queries that currently exist and that have the same id as the Query that was passed as a parameter, false if no Query exists that has the same ID
See Also:
Query

isConfigurationUnique

private boolean isConfigurationUnique(Configuration c)
Checks whether this Configuration object has been previously declared in the xml. By default the program will use the first instance of the id that it sees in the xml. A warning to the user is sent out.

Parameters:
c - - Configuration object
Returns:
- true if Configuration object is unique, false if it is a duplicate
See Also:
Configuration

getOligoCount

public int getOligoCount()
The maximum number of oligos that should be picked by SolPicker. This value is used to limit the number of oligos output by the program. If no value is specified in xml, the program does not restrict the number of oligos picked.

Returns:
any positive integer or -1 if no value is specified
See Also:
Oligo
